com.swopteam07.tablr.UI

Class Panel

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.swopteam07.tablr.UI.Component
      • com.swopteam07.tablr.UI.Container<T>
        • com.swopteam07.tablr.UI.DrawableContainer<Component>
          • com.swopteam07.tablr.UI.Panel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Scrollable, java.lang.Comparable<Component>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    WindowPanel

    public class Panel
extends DrawableContainer<Component>
implements Scrollable
    A class representing a container in which to place other components.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Panel

        public Panel(int x,
             int y,
             int height,
             int width,
             boolean visible,
             Component parent)
        Create a new panel with the given dimensions, visibility state.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the top left corner of the component relative to the parent component if it exists or the window if it doesn't.
        y - The y coordinate of the top left corner of the component.relative to the parent component if it exists or the window if it doesn't.
        height - The height of the component.
        width - The width of the component.
        visible - The visibility state of the new component.
        parent - The component that contains this component or null if this component has no parent.
        Effect:
        The panel is initialized as a container component with the given dimensions, visibility state and children.
            super(x, y, height, width, visible, parent)

      • Panel

        public Panel(int x,
             int y,
             int height,
             int width,
             Component parent)
        Create a new visible panel with the given dimensions.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the top left corner of the component relative to the parent component if it exists or the window if it doesn't.
        y - The y coordinate of the top left corner of the component.relative to the parent component if it exists or the window if it doesn't.
        height - The height of the component.
        width - The width of the component.
        parent - The component that contains this component or null if this component has no parent.
        Effect:
        The panel is initialized with the given parameters.
            this(x, y, height, width, true, parent)

      • updateContentWidthAndHeight

        public void updateContentWidthAndHeight()
        Description copied from class: Container
        Determine what the max x coordinate of the rightmost corners of the children and the max y coordinate of the bottom of the children are. This method should be called by resizable children when they're resized.
        Overrides:
        updateContentWidthAndHeight in class Container<Component>
